title: Guillemots...Walk the River(2011)[FLAC]
description:
1. Walk the River (5:09)
2. Vermillion (5:22)
3. I Don't Feel Amazing Now (5:27)
4. Ice Room (3:46)
5. Tigers (4:03)
6. Inside (5:17)
7. I Must Be a Lover (3:54)
8. Slow Train (4:42)
9. Sometimes I Remember Wrong (9:16)
10. The Basket (4:43)
11. Dancing in the Devil's Shoes (5:05)
12. Yesterday Is Dead (8:35)

Singer Fyfe Dangerfield calls Guillemots' third album "music to be heard across the night sky", which captures precisely its expansive beauty. Having got a yen for sparser songs out of his system with last year's solo album, he's returned with a zeal for large-scale emotion, and Walk the River is laden with it. It abounds in dramatic word-pictures, possibly pertaining to the end of the romance with the woman who inspired his solo LP ("Walk the river like a hunted animal", "When I see it I hear crashing drums") and sky-high choruses, arranged into some of the most sumptuous songs Guillemots have ever created. This is a group who don't believe in understatement, so there's a lot going on, from the fuzzy guitar and spacey synth squeaks that take The Basket in a psychedelic direction to Tiger's girl-group harmonies, but none of it feels superfluous Ã¢â‚¬â€œ every sound here contributes to a big, beautiful whole.
